intro: Orobanche perianthomega, commonly known as the yellow root broomrape, is a parasitic flowering plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on host plants for nutrients. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its lack of true leaves and stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in disturbed soils and can be a problematic weed in agricultural settings. Its life cycle involves germinating in response to chemical signals released by host plants, making it a challenging species to control.
